{"step_by_step_thinking": "Trisodium phosphate (TSP) is an inorganic compound that is highly soluble in water and produces an alkaline solution. It is used as a cleaning agent, builder, lubricant, food additive, stain remover, and degreaser. In the context of alginate, trisodium phosphate is used in conjunction with calcium sulfate to form calcium alginate gel. Therefore, trisodium phosphate in alginate acts as a reactor, facilitating the gelation process.", "answer_choice": "B. Reactor"}
